goal: Run data analysis on sklearn Iris dataset, include a plot

tasks.instruction: Perform exploratory data analysis on the Iris dataset, including loading the dataset, displaying summary statistics, and checking for missing values.
tasks.code:
import pandas as pd

# Load the Iris dataset
url = "https://archive.ics.uci.edu/ml/machine-learning-databases/iris/iris.data"
column_names = ["sepal_length", "sepal_width", "petal_length", "petal_width", "class"]
iris_df = pd.read_csv(url, names=column_names)

# Display summary statistics
print(iris_df.describe())

# Check for missing values
print(iris_df.isnull().sum())

tasks.instruction: Create visualizations to summarize the findings from the EDA, including a pairplot and boxplots for each feature by class, ensuring to import numpy as np.
tasks.code:
import numpy as np
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Create a pairplot to visualize relationships between features
sns.pairplot(iris_df, hue='class')
plt.show()

# Create boxplots for each feature by class
for column in iris_df.columns[:-1]:
    sns.boxplot(x='class', y=column, data=iris_df)
    plt.title(f'Boxplot of {column} by Class')
    plt.show()

import pandas as pd

# Load the Iris dataset
url = "https://archive.ics.uci.edu/ml/machine-learning-databases/iris/iris.data"
column_names = ["sepal_length", "sepal_width", "petal_length", "petal_width", "class"]

# Display summary statistics
print(iris_df.describe())

import numpy as np
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Create a pairplot to visualize relationships between features
sns.pairplot(iris_df, hue='class')
plt.show()

# Create boxplots for each feature by class
for column in iris_df.columns[:-1]:
    sns.boxplot(x='class', y=column, data=iris_df)
    plt.title(f'Boxplot of {column} by Class')
    plt.show()
